text.text: Can I balance-bill a COVID patient in ZOLL Billing?

text: You cannot balance-bill a COVID patient but they are still responsible for their co-pay and deductible.

text.text: During which period has Medicare suspended sequestration charges related to COVID-19?

text: Medicare has suspended sequestration charges from May 1st to December 31st.

text.text: What changes have been made to Medicare fee schedules regarding COVID-19?

text:
Medicare has made several changes to its fee schedules regarding COVID-19. These changes include:

* A temporary 25% increase in the Medicare Physician Fee Schedule (MPFS) for telehealth services provided during the COVID-19 pandemic.
* A temporary 25% increase in the Medicare Hospital Outpatient Prospective Payment System (OPPS) payment rates for COVID-19-related services.
* A temporary 25% increase in the Medicare Inpatient Prospective Payment System (IPPS) payment rates for COVID-19-related inpatient admissions.
* A temporary 25% increase in the Medicare Skilled Nursing Facility Prospective Payment System (SNF PPS) payment rates for COVID-19-related skilled nursing facility stays.
* A temporary 25% increase in the Medicare Home Health Prospective Payment System (HH PPS) payment rates for COVID-19-related home health services.
* A temporary 25% increase in

text.text: Under what circumstances does the COVID-19 button display in ZOLL Billing?

text: The COVID-19 button only displays if you enter one of the two COVID codes listed above as the primary diagnosis on the Incident Details tab.

text.text: What is the significance of running Insurance Discovery for COVID-19 patients in ZOLL Billing?

text: Running Insurance Discovery for COVID-19 patients in ZOLL Billing is important because it will help you to identify the correct insurance carrier to bill.

text.text: How does the appearance of the primary payer box differ based on the COVID-19 diagnosis entered?

text:
The primary payer box will display the following options based on the COVID-19 diagnosis entered:

* If you enter the code U07.1, the primary payer box will display the option "Medicare".
* If you enter the code U07.2, the primary payer box will display the option "Medicaid".
* If you enter any other code, the primary payer box will display the option "Other".

text.text: When should I click the COVID-19 Uninsured Program button on the COB tab?

text: You should click the COVID-19 Uninsured Program button on the COB tab if the patient is uninsured.

text.text: What action should I take if a patient is uninsured and diagnosed with COVID-19 in ZOLL Billing?

text: If a patient is uninsured and diagnosed with COVID-19 in ZOLL Billing, you should click the COVID-19 Uninsured Program button on the COB tab.

text.text: How does the FFCRA affect cost-sharing for COVID-19 testing-related services in ZOLL Billing?

text: The Families First Coronavirus Response Act (FFCRA) waives cost-sharing for COVID-19 testing-related services for Medicare Part B patients.

text.text: Which services are subject to cost-sharing waivers under the FFCRA for Medicare Part B patients?

text: Cost-sharing is waived for office visits that result in the order or administration of the COVID-19 test and the evaluation of an individual to determine the need for a COVID-19 test.

text.text: What dates are covered by the cost-sharing waiver under the FFCRA?

text: The cost-sharing waiver is in effect for dates of service starting March 18, 2020 until the end of the public health emergency.

text.text: How do physicians signal the cost-sharing waiver to Medicare Administrative Contractors (MACs) in ZOLL Billing?

text: Physicians should use the CS modifier on applicable claims to identify the service subject to the cost-sharing waiver.

text.text: What action should physicians take for claims submitted without the CS modifier for COVID-19-related services?

text: Physicians should contact their MACs and request to resubmit applicable claims with dates of service on or after March 18, 2020 that were submitted without the CS modifier.

text.text: When should the CS modifier be used?

text: Physicians should use the CS modifier on applicable claims to identify the service subject to the cost-sharing waiver.

text.text: What is the purpose of revenue adjustments ?

text: Revenue adjustments are used to correct errors in the amount of revenue that was originally billed.

text.text: How do I navigate to the Credits tab on the Claim page?

text:
To navigate to the Credits tab on the Claim page, follow these steps:

1. Click the "Claims" tab at the top of the screen.
2. Select the claim that you want to view.
3. Click the "Credits" tab at the top of the screen.

text.text: What steps do I follow to adjust the balance using revenue adjustments?

text:
To adjust the balance using revenue adjustments, follow these steps:

1. On the Claim page, click the "Credits" tab.
2. Click the "Adjust balance" button.
3. When the "Adjust balance" window opens, click "Revenue adjustment".
4. Click the "Description" field and choose a description from the list.
5. Enter the adjustment amount for each HCPCS.
6. Click "Post now".

text.text: What options are available in the description field when making a revenue adjustment for COVID-related services?

text: When making a revenue adjustment for COVID-related services, the only option available in the description field is "COVID".

text.text: How does the claim status change after making a revenue adjustment?

text: The status of the claim will change to "Closed - Balance resolved".

text.text: What is the outcome of clicking the "Post now" button after making a revenue adjustment?

text: The new balance will display at the bottom of the window. You can view the revenue adjustment in the Credits, Running Claim Balance, and Running Charge Balance tabs on the Claim page.

text.text: Where do I enter the U07.1 or B97.29 code in the Incident Details tab?

text: Enter U07.1 or B97.29 as the primary diagnosis code in the Incident Details tab.

text.text: COVID 19 information

text:
**COVID-19 Information**

* **Cost-sharing waiver:** The cost-sharing waiver is in effect for dates of service starting March 18, 2020 until the end of the public health emergency. Physicians should use the CS modifier on applicable claims to identify the service subject to the cost-sharing waiver. Medicare beneficiaries should not be charged for any coinsurance or deductible for those services.
* **Uninsured patients:** If the patient is uninsured, click the COVID-19 Uninsured Program button on the COB tab.
* **Testing-related services:** The CS modifier should be used to identify the service as subject to the cost-sharing waiver for COVID-19 testing-related services.
For more information click this: https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=5tji9110ru
